bloom ： 主要指诸如牡丹、玫瑰、梅花、菊花等供观赏的花以及花的状态。
blossom ： 一般指树木开花，尤指果树上开的花。
flower ： 指开放的花朵或泛指花卉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  blōstm, blōstma (noun), blōstmian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bloesem, also to bloom

encyclopedia.content: Blossom始于2000年，其专营的中高档手表凭借精致的外观和精湛的工艺，独特的设计和高品质的产品代表着一种舒适、优雅的生活态度，并以绿色环保的原则涵盖了各种不同类型的手表所打造出卓尔不凡的品牌风格。

entry.def: Blossom is the flowers that appear on a tree before the fruit.

example.ex: The cherry blossom came out early in Washington this year.
example.tran: 今年华盛顿的樱花开得很早。

example.ex: ...the blossoms of plants, shrubs and trees.

entry.tran: 兴盛；变得有魅力；变得成功
entry.def: If someone or something blossoms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.

example.ex: Why do some people take longer than others to blossom?...
example.tran: 为什么有的人比他人大器晚成？

example.ex: What began as a local festival has blossomed into an international event.
example.tran: 最初的地方节日已经发展成了国际性盛会。

entry.def: When a tree blossoms, it produces blossom.

example.ex: Rain begins to fall and peach trees blossom.
example.tran: 开始下雨了，桃树也开花了。

means.word_mean: 1. reproductive organ of angiosperm plants especially one having showy or colorful parts
2. the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
2. develop or come to a promising stage;

auth_sentence.content: Blossom is a sure sign that spring has arrived.

auth_sentence.content: Whether love itself will blossom is the whole story.

auth_sentence.content: Mrs. Reagan, in adversity, appeared to blossom.

sentences.en: The oriental cherry is in full blossom.
The fruit trees have blossomed out beautifully.
New industries can blossom overnight if we find an outlet for their products.
sentences.cn: 如果我们为新兴产业的产品找到销路, 它们短期内就会成长起来。
她的音乐天赋很早就展现了。

jushi.english: They all went to enjoy the cherry blossoms.
The plum trees begin to blossom.
The apple trees blossom in spring and are laden with fruit in autumn.
jushi.chinese: 苹果树春天开花,到秋天果实累累。
